title: Disconnecting from PVP.net
body:
I keep disconnecting from PVP.net. It poses no problem while playing, but finding games, creating lobbies, champ picks/bans, and changing spells, masteries and runes can sometimes be a problem. I disconnect about 3 times while creating/searching for a game and another 3 in champ select. It wasn't much of a problem because I was lucky enough to not d/c when it was my turn to pick, until just now. The lobby I was just in, I was first pick. I banned all three champs and picked mine fine. Thirty seconds later the client frosted over (not sure if its a related problem) and closed. The person I was duoing with said it hadn't crashed, so I figured I'd reload while the game was loading. A moment later he said that it cancelled, and that "Phat Dubz failed to select a champion" which is clearly not the case. I then had to wait a 5 minute timer before searching for a new game.

This obviously isn't my direct fault, and while annoying the issue was tolerable. But now I've been penalised 3LP and a 5 minute timer (a small penalty that I'm not fussed about, but it can lead to more severe punishments). SO -- what's the fix?

replies.body: Same here! I can't even play with my mates! RIOT it's weekend, please don't ruin it. FIX IT PLEASE!

I don't know if it helps. I was searching for some way to solve it. In an old post about this:
press windows key + r
type in "services.msc"
go to: ip helper
shut it down

This has been the only thing that works for me, but I need to do it every time my computer restarts. I'm grateful for the solution, but it's just a temporary fix. The problem shouldn't exist to begin with. Riot's gotta do something :)

Although your intentions are good, you shouldn't really be telling people to be doing potentially dangerous (in terms of permanent connection loss) things that just happened to help you.

Of course, this isn't the case, but just saying. If this was something like IPv6 you could be telling someone to do something that will destroy their computer's connection.

After restarting my computer IP Helper turned itself back on (so I assume it's meant to be on by this + your comment). What's the risks/disadvantages of turning IP Helper off? Now that it's back on, League is playing up again.

It allows your computer to communicate to via IPv4 even if it's restricted to a IPv6 network. Think of it as backwards compatibility. Disabling it would mean that if your computer is only allowed to communicate using IPv6, then it would just have no way of communicating to older devices (including servers that have not enabled IPv6 yet). This problem would actually go unnoticeable for the time being. In fact I'd bet that you wouldn't notice it for at least four more years. But eventually the limitations of remaining with IPv4 will outweigh the benefits of keeping it enabled and hence it'll be removed by most services. They'll probably just say, "We improved connectivity," or something similar to explain it.

tl dr; Disabling it won't have any noticeable effect.
I'm currently in champ select and haven't had a problem yet since doing this. I'll post again after a few games, but for now it seems like this fixed it. Thanks heaps.
What OS are you on, and what ISP are you with?

Dodo isn't exactly the 'best' ISP. It *might* be on their end.

Have you tried [using an alternative DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq5)? Be aware that it could disable some services that your ISP provides you, like a data meter.
Yeah, that didn't work. Thanks though.

Read through the entirety of [this](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664) and try everything you haven't tried yet. Mainly, flushing DNS might do it for you. If you need any help with going through with them, just ask.

Best of luck.
I now have a 15 minute queue ban. I've repaired my client as well.
